content.question: Two cars are stopped next to each other and at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> the cars begin to move in the same direction. One car has a constant acceleration <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> until time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and the displacement of this car from <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math>. If the second car has a constant acceleration of <math alttext="the fraction a sub 1, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math> until time <math alttext="2 t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, what is the displacement of the second car from <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="2 t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
